Hello,

I'm new with junit testing, and was wondering if anyone would have =
a
suggestion about this... I have a test case of 6 test methods. As I
figur=
ed so far, each test method invokes setUp and tearDown methods
once. In set=
Up method I defined some user parameters (USER_ID, and
such...) which are t=
hen passed to the test methods. I get these
parameters from file and then p=
ut them into an arraylist (which is not
entirely necessary, but hey...). Wh=
at I need to know if there is a
simple way of passing the same USER_ID to a=
ll the test methods, and -
after all the methods have been executed - to pa=
ss the next USER_ID,
and so forth... Basically, one USER_ID per test case e=
xecution/iteration.

Iterating through an arraylist in setUp method, since =
the testcase is
instantiated as many times as there are methods in that cas=
e, will
make it iterate through every n-th record in file, n being the numb=
er
of methods. That's pretty much silly and useless.

Annotations (@BeforeC=
lass and such) are a no-no.

Any help is welcome, thanks.
Tomislav
